nodes.bodyText:
Can be moved into a separate method, say validatePartSize
and/or
a method that can validate the given combination of partSize and objectSize
The part size calculation logic (including part from the if block) can be moved to a separate method, with a comment explaining the logic.
In what scenario be pSize <= 0 at this place?
These two variables may not be required..
There's a lot of overlap with PutObjectArgs. Can this be extracted out into a common base class?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,112 @@

+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package io.minio;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.nio.file.Files;
+import java.nio.file.Paths;
+
+/** Argument class of MinioClient.uploadObject(). */
+public class UploadObjectArgs extends ObjectWriteArgs {

nodes.bodyText: Some of the validations here are the same as those in PutObjectArgs. Might be a good idea to put them in a common method and call from both places.
Maybe just log/print the exception so that it can be debugged..
